intro: Oxytropis sutaica, commonly known as the Siberian locoweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to the temperate regions of Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its spiny stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to violet, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Oxytropis sutaica is adapted to grow in dry, rocky soils and is often found in alpine or steppe environments. It is also known for its toxic properties, containing alkaloids that can be harmful to livestock.
